data.title: Gus Johnson's Profile, Net Worth, Age, Height, Relationships, FAQs
data.meta_description: Get to know all about your favorite YouTuber celebrity and Internet sensation Gus Johnson's Net Worth, Age, Social Media, Career, FAQs and more.
data.text:
Gus Johnson's journey into the world of online content creation was seeded in his upbringing, where access to a camera and editing tools was readily available, thanks to his grandfather's ownership of a computer repair and photography shop. It was during his formative years, around sixth and seventh grade, that Gus began crafting short videos, pedaling around his hometown with pals, concocting what he fondly termed as "silly sketches" that resonated with his youthful audience. September 12, 2010, marked the inception of his YouTube venture, marked by the poignant ode titled "Ian's Song," penned in loving memory of a friend lost too soon to a tragic swimming mishap. With each passing year, Gus diligently nurtured his YouTube presence, dishing out bite-sized meme content featuring himself and his buddies. However, it wasn't until the fateful upload of "How To Get Free Food From Subway" on August 15, 2015, that his digital star began its meteoric ascent.

By the time he wrapped up his collegiate chapter in 2018, Gus had already solidified his status as a full-time YouTube luminary with a staggering 400K subscribers under his belt. Simultaneously, he inked a deal with a prominent talent agency, propelling his acting ambitions forward amidst the glitzy backdrop of Los Angeles. In the initial stages of his YouTube tenure, music took center stage, with Gus serenading his audience with covers and original compositions. Collaborating with hometown buddy Joe Dumas, he birthed the albums "Lighting Rods and Leaky Roofs" in 2015 and "Champagne Seats" in 2016. Transitioning seamlessly into the podcasting realm alongside friend Eddy Burback with "OK I'll Talk," Gus's creative odyssey culminated in a triumphant move to LA, where he birthed the uproarious "Gus & Eddy Podcast" with Eddy.

Not one to rest on his laurels, Gus spearheaded a Kickstarter initiative in 2017 to fund his brainchild, "Par 9," a comedic saga set on a dilapidated golf course. This tireless dedication to his craft garnered him recognition at the esteemed Shorty Awards, where he clinched finalist status in the Best YouTube Comedian category. Crossing the monumental milestone of one million subscribers in 2019, Gus extended heartfelt gratitude to his legion of fans while embarking on exciting collaborations with Viacom and Comedy Central, cementing his status as an influential voice in digital comedy.

Gus Johnson is a vibrant YouTuber whose channel bursts with amazing content. He dives into collecting day-to-day life vlogs and other entertaining content. Some of his interesting videos are -

In this captivating video, Gus is acting as a thief and a policeman for a funny vine. The video has already amassed over 5.4 million views and garnered an impressive 257k likes, showcasing its widespread appeal.

In this captivating video, Gus is getting a haircut from his mom. The video has already garnered over 4.9 million views and an impressive 210k likes, resonating deeply with viewers.

In this video, Gus is talking about the worst YouTube sponsors, and it's already a hit with over 4.1 million views and 185k likes.

YouTube Series

Aside from his entertaining video content, Guss has curated several captivating video series playlists. One such series, "Popular Uploads | Gus Johnson", features Gus’s popular videos in 646 engaging episodes.

Additionally, "Commentary Videos | Gus Johnson" showcases some of his best commentary videos. This series has a total of 30 episodes.

Top Videos of the ‘Gus Johnson’ channel

This is the most popular video on Gus’s YouTube channel. This video has 49 million views with over 1.7 million likes.

This is the second most-viewed video on Gus’s channel in which Gus is intimating a growing-up kid who tries to be tough. This video has more than 16 million views with 453k likes.

This is a Vine in which Gus is acting as a friend who always has a knife and this video has more than 14 million views and 501k likes.

Gus found himself embroiled in controversy due to his relationship with Sabrina. They had been together for a while, and Gus often showcased their bond in his videos. However, things took a turn in 2021 when Gus publicly announced their breakup. It later came to light that before their separation, Sabrina underwent a difficult ectopic surgery while pregnant. Shockingly, Gus pressured her to terminate the pregnancy and even threatened to end their relationship if she didn't comply. Instead of being there for Sabrina during her surgery, Gus chose to spend time drinking with friends, displaying verbal abuse towards her in the process.

When Sabrina later shared her experience, she initially didn't name Gus directly, but it was soon revealed through social media. In another instance, when Sabrina needed support during rhinoplasty surgery, Gus opted to play video games online instead. After Sabrina publicly disclosed the abuse she endured, Gus faced significant backlash, prompting him to issue an apology and step back from his online activities temporarily. However, he later returned to the platform with a controversial comedy sketch that drew criticism for its insensitivity.

In response to the backlash, Gus uploaded a video attempting to address the situation and his feelings about it. However, his attempt was met with mixed reactions, with many accusing him of downplaying the severity of his actions. Sabrina also refuted his claims about attending couples therapy, revealing that their sessions were actually about Gus's desire to pursue other relationships. Despite ongoing controversies, Gus attempted a comeback, including an interview where he attempted to present his side of the story with empathy towards Sabrina. However, Sabrina's subsequent response raised doubts among viewers, leading to continued debate and divided opinions among fans regarding the truth of their respective narratives.
